=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Here’s an overview of the game based on the rules provided:

• Game Type and Setting:
 – This is a classic space shooter with arcade-style mechanics.
 – The screen is filled with a space-themed background and a planet-like base, hinting at a battle taking place above a home world.
 – The player controls a spaceship (the “avatar”) that flies around at the bottom of the screen.

• Core Mechanics:
 – The player’s ship (“avatar”) can fire projectiles called “sam” that travel upward.
 – Enemies (aliens) are spawned at fixed “portal” points along the top. Two types of aliens appear—blue and green—using two different spawn points. One type spawns at a slower rate (portalSlow) and another faster (portalFast).
 – The aliens move across the screen, bouncing back when they hit the edges (they “turn around” when reaching the screen boundaries).
 – Some aliens are “bombers” that can drop bombs, which travel downward slowly, representing enemy fire.
 – Other projectiles include “missile” (likely another type of shot) and “bomb” (enemy attack).

• Interactions and Collisions:
 – When the player’s projectile “sam” hits an alien, it destroys the alien and boosts the score (+2 points).
 – If a “sam” projectile collides with the base, both objects are removed, but you also gain a smaller bonus (+1).
 – However, if the player’s ship collides with an alien or with an enemy bomb, the enemy projectile is removed yet the player is penalized (score decreases by 1 in both cases). This suggests that a direct collision is risky.
 – There’s also a rule where if a bomb hits the base, both the bomb and the base vanish, which may indirectly affect your defense or objectives.
 – Missiles disappearing off-screen are simply removed, and the avatar “steps back” at the edge of the screen, so the game manages objects that go out of bounds.

• Objectives and Winning Conditions:
 – The player must eliminate all enemy aliens. The win condition is met when there are no enemy portals and no aliens left on the screen.
 – Conversely, if the player’s spaceship (“avatar”) is destroyed (i.e. the number drops to 0), the game is lost.

• General Strategy:
 – Focus on shooting enemies: Use your upward-firing “sam” to take down aliens for a score boost, especially targeting them before they have the chance to drop bombs.
 – Dodge enemy fire: Avoid collisions with alien ships and falling bombs since both types of collisions result in a score penalty and potential loss of your ship.
 – Keep moving: The “avatar” has a “stepBack” action at screen edges, so be mindful of boundaries while dodging enemies.
 – Manage risk vs. reward: Sometimes destroying your own base with a “sam” projectile might give a small bonus, but overall, protecting your assets (and your ship) is key.
 – Clear the board: Since victory is achieved when all enemy alien sprites and spawn portals are gone, pace your offensive while ensuring you avoid damage.

In short, you’re playing a fast-paced space shooter in which you must skillfully maneuver your spaceship while shooting down waves of aliens and dodging bombs. The best strategy is to focus on eliminating enemies methodically, keeping an eye on enemy projectiles, and avoiding collisions to protect your ship until all adversaries have been cleared.

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game.
